elm:value.value: Family member X in concepts tab

elm:annotation.a:s: Any access of the patient record
System runs on routine frequency
Include adult outpatients
Have a first-degree family member with a history of colorectal cancer or advanced adenoma
Have a family or personal history of Lynch Syndrome or familial colorectal cancer syndrome type X
Have a personal history of colorectal cancer or advanced adenoma
Age >= 50
Who have had a total colectomy
Are receiving hospice or end-of-life care
Have a documented decision to stop colorectal cancer screening
Age >= 85
Flexible sigmoidoscopy within 5 years
Colonoscopy within within 10 years
Double-contrast barium enema within 5 years
Computed tomography colonography within 5 years
Guaiac-based fecal occult blood test with high test sensitivity for cancer within 1 year
Fecal immunochemical test with high test sensitivity for cancer within 1 year
Stool Deoxyribonucleic Acid (DNA) testing within 3 years
Have any first-degree relative diagnosed with colorectal cancer or advanced adenoma
Have a personal history of colorectal cancer or other colorectal neoplasia
Are known to have Lynch syndrome or have a first-degree relative with Lynch Syndrome
Have a family history of familial colorectal cancer syndrome type X
Have a personal history of inflammatory bowel disease
Had a positive result on the most recent imaging colorectal cancer screening test (double-contrast barium enema or computed tomography colonography) and have not had a follow-up colonoscopy
Had an abnormal result on the most recent flexible colonoscopy colorectal cancer screening and have not had a follow-up colonoscopy

Had a positive result on the most recent stool-based colorectal cancer screening test (guaiac-based fecal occult blood test, fecal immunochemical test, or stool DNA test) and have not had a follow-up colonoscopy
Had a finding of inadequate bowel prep on most recent colonoscopy

textEquivalent.value: Identify the patient as a colorectal cancer screening candidate
Open Documentation Template/Consult Request: Gastroenterology: Colorectal Cancer Risk KNART
Open Order Set: Gastroenterology: Colorectal Cancer Risk - Average Risk Screening KNART
Make sure guideline recommendations are available to care team

elm:annotation.a:s: Patient with exactly one first-degree relative diagnosed with colorectal cancer or advanced adenoma if the affected relative was diagnosed at age >= 60 years
Flexible sigmoidoscopy within 5 years
Colonoscopy within within 10 years
Double-contrast barium enema within 5 years
Computed tomography colonography within 5 years
Guaiac-based fecal occult blood test with high test sensitivity for cancer within 1 year
Fecal immunochemical test with high test sensitivity for cancer within 1 year
Stool Deoxyribonucleic Acid (DNA) testing within 3 years
Have any first-degree relative diagnosed with colorectal cancer or advanced adenoma
Have a personal history of colorectal cancer or other colorectal neoplasia
Are known to have Lynch syndrome or have a first-degree relative with Lynch Syndrome
Have a family history of familial colorectal cancer syndrome type X
Have a personal history of inflammatory bowel disease
Had a positive result on the most recent imaging colorectal cancer screening test (double-contrast barium enema or computed tomography colonography) and have not had a follow-up colonoscopy
Had an abnormal result on the most recent flexible colonoscopy colorectal cancer screening and have not had a follow-up colonoscopy

Had a positive result on the most recent stool-based colorectal cancer screening test (guaiac-based fecal occult blood test, fecal immunochemical test, or stool DNA test) and have not had a follow-up colonoscopy
Had a finding of inadequate bowel prep on most recent colonoscopy

textEquivalent.value: Identify the patient as a colorectal cancer screening candidate
Open Documentation TemplateโConsult Request: Gastroenterology: Colorectal Cancer Risk KNART
Open Order Set: Family History of Colon Cancer, Colon Cancer Syndrome or Advanced Adenoma KNART
Open Order Set: Fecal Immunochemical Test (FIT)
Make sure guideline recommendations are available to care team.

logic.elm:annotation: Include adult outpatients whose most recent colorectal cancer screening colonoscopy results indicated that the bowel prep was inadequate where either the timeframe specified for rescoping the patient has been exceeded or no timeframe for rescoping the patient was indicated.

textEquivalent.value: Identify the patient as a colorectal cancer screening candidate
Open Documentation TemplateโConsult Request: Gastroenterology: Colorectal Cancer Risk KNART
Open Order Set: Family History of Colon Cancer, Colon Cancer Syndrome or Advanced Adenoma KNART
Open Order Set: Fecal Immunochemical Test (FIT)
Make sure guideline recommendations are available to care team.

logic.elm:annotation: Most recent colorectal cancer screening imaging tests (double-contrast barium enema or computed tomography colonography) were positive and no follow-up colonoscopy completed
Most recent flexible sigmoidoscopy colorectal cancer screening tests were positive, and no follow-up colonoscopy completed

textEquivalent.value: Identify the patient as a colorectal cancer screening candidate

Open Order Set: Family History of Colon Cancer, Colon Cancer Syndrome or Advanced Adenoma KNART
